recipe_description: A delicious and spicy fish curry made with fresh fish and a variety of aromatic spices.
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine the ginger paste, garlic paste, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, garam masala powder, plain yogurt, lemon juice, and salt. Mix well to form a marinade.
Rub the marinade all over the chicken, making sure to coat it evenly. You can use your hands to do this.
Cover the chicken and let it marinate for at least 4-6 hours, or overnight in the refrigerator for best results.
Preheat the oven to 200°C.
Brush a roasting pan with mustard oil and place the chicken in the pan.
Add the green chilies on top of the chicken.
Drizzle some more mustard oil over the chicken and roast in the preheated oven for 40-50 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and golden brown.
Serve hot with your favorite side dishes like roasted vegetables, rice, or naan.

recipe_description: A classic rice dish made with succulent chicken, fragrant spices, and basmati rice.
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine the ginger paste, garlic paste, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, garam masala powder, plain yogurt, lemon juice, and salt. Mix well to form a marinade.

recipe_ingredients: 1 lb. chicken breast, cut into small pieces

recipe_description: A traditional Bengali dish made with Hilsa fish and mustard paste.
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, add the ground beef or lamb.
Add the chopped onions, coriander leaves, mint leaves, green chillies, cumin seeds, coriander seeds, red chilli powder, and salt to the bowl.
Mix all the ingredients thoroughly with your hands. You can also use a food processor to blend the mixture for a smoother texture.
Once the oil is hot, gently place the Chapli Kababs in the pan and fry them for about 4-5 minutes on each side until they are golden brown.
Once done, take the Kababs out of the pan and place them on a paper towel to remove excess oil.
Serve hot with your choice of chutney or yogurt dip.

Wash the mutton and drain the water.
In a bowl, mix the mutton, yogurt, onion, garlic paste, ginger paste, green chili, salt, and sugar. Marinate for at least 2 hours.
Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes.
Heat ghee in a pot and add the cardamom, cinnamon stick, bay leaves, cloves, and mace. Fry for 1-2 minutes.
Add the marinated mutton and fry for 5-10 minutes until the meat is browned.
Add water and bring to a boil. Cook until the mutton is half done.
In a separate pot, boil water with salt and add the soaked rice. Cook until the rice is 3/4th done. Drain the water.
In the pot with the half-cooked mutton, add a layer of rice. Sprinkle saffron and pour the milk over the rice.
Add another layer of rice and repeat the process with saffron and milk.
Cover the pot and cook on low heat until the rice and mutton are fully cooked and the liquid has been absorbed.
Serve hot with raita and salad.
recipe_description: A slow-cooked rice dish made with marinated meat and fragrant spices.
